sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Austria is the latest country to enter in a fourth lockdown since the start of the pandemic.

sentences.sentence: The country's low vaccination rate has led to record after record in the number of infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Vienna will make vaccinations mandatory in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The new restrictions will remain in place until the 13th of December at the latest.

sentences.sentence: The Christmas period will be interrupted for several weeks and many Austrians used its last day of normality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many are just resigned, but for business owners it's a big hit.

sentences.sentence: We're not in a good mood. We had these six weeks ready in our plans.

sentences.sentence: Belgium will make teleworking mandatory most of the week and will broaden the use of the face masks after the number of the face masks after the number of new Covid cases has reached worrying levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Czech Republic will also apply stricter rules, especially with the unvaccinated population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Negative coronavirus tests will not be recognized as Covid certificate to go to a hairdresser or a restaurant. Companies must also test unvaccinated workers on a weekly basis from Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany had already imposed stricter measures, closures of some public places, more control over the non-vaccinated. Now the German authorities are debating, due to the low inoculation rate, whether to make the vaccine mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Austrian teachers and parents are quite confused about the new hard lockdown measures which come into effect today in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: effect today in Austria. While most non-essential shops remain closed as well as theaters and bars and restaurants, schools remain open. But the Austrian government urges parents to keep their children at home and safe because school children have among the highest seven-day incidence rates in Austria. But parents are not just worried about their children's education, but also about the mandatory vaccination, which has been introduced in Austria or will be introduced before 1st of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A lot of protesters have hit the streets on Saturday in Viennaz there were thousands of protesters and many of them against a mandatory vaccine, especially for the children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But it is likely that the European Medicines Agency will approve, for example, the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine also for children starting age five.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So it is possible that the mandatory vaccine will apply also to them in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Dozens of people marched on Sunday in the Polish city of Bialystok, close to the border with Belarus, to support the border guards amidst the ongoing crisis that facing the country. A resounding response to the activist demonstration on Saturday a few kilometres to the south asking the Polish government to assist the migrants.

sentences.sentence: The Polish Prime Minister Morawiecki met on Saturday with representatives of the three Baltic republics gathering their support on a crisis that could soon be their crisis too.

sentences.sentence: In the meantime, hundreds of migrants wait for their turn to cross the border or to be repatriated in a warehouse near the Brusgi checkpoint. The Belarusian regime wants to show that it is taking care of them and providing them with shelter and food but Poland keeps reporting migrants attempts to cross the border its border guards remain vigilant and on patrol exit polls in Bulgaria suggest Ruman Radev has comfortably won a second term in the country's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Several surveys gave Radev around two-thirds of the vote on Sunday, which would mean he will serve another five-year term in the largely ceremonial role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: His main opponent, Anastas Gerzhikov, secured around 32 per cent, according to the exit poll, with only a handful of voters not picking either candidate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Radev was a firm supporter of last year's anti-corruption protests and attracted many Bulgarians who are fed up with politicians they see as corrupt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But others stayed away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Central Election Commission figures said turnout on Sunday was lower even than the 40% recorded in the first round of the contest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Part of that might be because the coronavirus is raging through Bulgaria, which has the highest Covid mortality rate in the world and the lowest vaccination rate in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Chinese tennis star Peng Shui has told the International Olympic Committee she's safe and well, nearly three weeks after she made sexual assault allegations against a senior Chinese minister, then disappeared from public view.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The IOC's President Thomas Bach said they they spoke on Sunday and Peng told him she was at home in Beijing but wanted her privacy respected for the moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Chinese state media has released several videos of the tennis star appearing at a tournament in the country's capital and at a restaurant in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But her supporters abroad, including the Women's Tennis Association, had said they feared she was being coerced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Peng had alleged she was forced into sexual relations with the former Chinese vice premier Zhang Gaoli, but her post was removed from social media within minutes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Far rightist José Antonio Kast and hard leftist Gabriel Boric will run in the second round for the Chilean presidency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kast, an ultra-conservative and admirer of Pinochet's dictatorship, won the first round and leads the polls ahead of the second.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His campaign has been based on public security, migration and Christian values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Long live Chile! We are going to work to restore peace, order, progress and our freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Starting today, every woman who cannot go home in peace because of crime and harassment has hope of living in peace. Cast's opponent, Gabriel Boric, a former student's leader, offers a completely different agenda to voters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His economic plan is centred in expanding the welfare state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The huge inequalities in the Chilean system were the main reason for the massive protests in Chile that ended in a new constitutional process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The election has proven to show a divide among Chileans so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The current president, Sebastián Piñera, asked the candidates to seek the path of responsibility and not of populism, the path of truth and not of polarisation.

sentences.sentence: The second round will take place on the 19th of december a former driver from rwanda will go on trial here in the french capital on monday for his

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: involvement in a 1994 rwanda genocide claudeouhaimana is accused of complicity for driving Hutu militia men who later massacred hundreds of Tutsis in the western Kibui region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Investigators also say, though, that Mr. Mouhaimana has hid Tutsis at risk of death and even helped others escape.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: His lawyer says that he's been waiting for a chance to fully explain himself for over a decade now. This is going to be the third such trial of Rwandan genocide suspects here in France whose judicial system grants universal jurisdiction to judges prosecuting crimes against humanity and France has for years denied requests for extradition from Rwandan authorities, fueling a row between the two nations, with President Paul Kagame accusing France of denying Rwanda jurisdiction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Some 30 trials of Rwanda genocide suspects await to be heard by French courts, and that of Mr. Muhaymana is set to last for a month. sentences.sentence: The kids were playing with it when it suddenly started emitting smoke. Mahmoud was not home when the explosion happened, but he got the call to head towards the hospital.

sentences.sentence: I went to the hospital and no one told me anything. They said, nothing happened to your kids, don't be scared. And then… Reem flew for 10 meters and I flew for 5.

sentences.sentence: Maryam and Reem went through 16 operations to save their lives while their brothers, Mustafa aged 12 and Yassine, 2, died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Six years ago, the café's manager began specialising in events where customers can bring in damaged electrical devices and have them repaired free of charge. We have to take care of the planet.

sentences.sentence: We can't afford to live like we used to live, so we have to make a movement about not throwing things out when it's still working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some devices are built in a way that makes them very difficult to open and repair. Sometimes it's even impossible to bring them back to life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Whether it's glue in the product that makes it very difficult to take out a part and replace it, whether it's the use of proprietary tools, meaning you need to have specific tools that are linked to the manufacturer to open a product, or whether it's the fact that spare parts or repair information are very difficult to access.
